questions.q: What does the metaphor mean? The classroom was a zoo during the party.

choices.t: The classroom had animals.
The classroom was very chaotic and noisy.

questions.q: What does the simile mean? She sings like an angel.

choices.t: She is an angel.
She sings beautifully.

questions.q: What is the meaning of the metaphor? His mind is a steel trap.

choices.t: His mind is made of steel.
He has a very sharp and quick mind.

questions.q: What does the simile mean? The baby's skin is as soft as silk.

choices.t: The baby's skin is made of silk.
The baby's skin is very soft.

questions.q: What is the meaning of the metaphor? Time is a thief.

choices.t: Time steals objects.
Time passes quickly and is gone before you know it.

questions.q: What does the simile mean? His words were as smooth as honey.

choices.t: His words were made of honey.
His words were pleasing and persuasive.

questions.q: What is the meaning of the metaphor? Her eyes are stars.

choices.t: Her eyes are made of star material.
Her eyes are bright and sparkling.

questions.q: What does the simile mean? The car roared down the road like a lion.

choices.t: The car turned into a lion.
The car made a loud and powerful noise as it went down the road.

questions.q: What is the meaning of the metaphor? Life is a journey.

choices.t: Life is a physical trip.
Life is a process with challenges and achievements, much like a journey.

questions.q: What does the simile mean? The water was as clear as crystal.

choices.t: The water was made of crystal.
The water was very clear and transparent.
